channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024110099
item.description:
Report X-2024110099

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: CAMDENTON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE FOR CONTENT INSPECTION DUE TO THE RATTLE SOUND OF AN AEROSOL CAN. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A 13.2 OUNCE AEROSOL CAN OF EXTREMELY FLAMMABLE LAC R'SHOT! GUN LIKE LACQUER SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024110031
item.description:
Report X-2024110031

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-28
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN EARTH CITY, MISSOURI, A MULTIPLE SHIPMENT OF NINE PACKAGES FROM THE USA TO HONG KONG WERE BEING INSPECTED PRIOR TO EXPORT. INVOICE DESCRIPTION ON EACH BOX DESCRIBE CONTENTS AS 819 USED MOBILE PHONES (FOR REPAIR WORK). THERMAL TRACKING LABELS DESCRIBE CONTENTS AS IPHONES FOR REPAIR. ALL NINE BOXES HAVE BEEN COMPLETELY SEALED IN SECURITY TAPE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER BOXES. INSPECTION REVEALS MULTIPLE CELL PHONES WITH EACH ENCLOSED IN CLEAR PLASTIC. THE PHONES HAVE STICKERS APPLIED DESCRIBING PHYSICAL AND/OR INTERNAL ASSESSMENTS SUCH AS NOTED DAMAGE, DEFECTS AND BATTERY HEALTH. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS IN THE MULTI PIECE SHIPMENT TO HONG KONG ARE 1Z6X37F90411825022, 1Z6X37F90401098793, 1Z6X37F90413388831, 1Z6X37F90400476368, 1Z6X37F90400924007, 1Z6X37F90401086840, 1Z6X37F90402631418 AND 1Z6X37F90419231784. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024100475
item.description:
Report E-2024100475

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of Eco Bright FM 654 Oven Cleaner released from one (1) twenty (20) gallon plastic drum. Personnel advised the release impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel advised they cleaned up spill with Oil Dri absorbent. Personnel generated one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum of waste containing spent absorbents and spilled product for disposal. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
